WorkItem.Description: Consider supprting "event" keyword as well as "+=" and "-=" operator to add/remove event handlers. The "event" keyword would prevent from direct assigning handlers only allowing to add/remove individual listeners. Currently, it's not syntactically easy for a class to expose an event.

Comments.Message:
But how would it work?

Remember, TypeScript is compiled I to JS. So any proposal should first consider how it all fits into JS semantic.

Well, it's pretty straightforward... a compiler would generate a field inside class that would store array of event handlers. "+=" op would add to that list and "-=" would remove from it. Something similar to MulticastDelegate in .NET
"+=" and "-=" are already in use as compound assignment operators, addition and subtraction respectively.
